roleset.name: kick
roleset.note: BOOT-V NOTES: frame created by Jena (from boot.01-v)
BOOT-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry boot.01, OntoNotes grouping boot-n; no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from boot.01-n)

roles.note: No examples found with Arg2, but maybe? (from boot.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Mary booted John from her office.

example.name: ArgMs only
example.text: The player gave the football a good boot that sent it over the goal posts.
example.arg: that sent it over the goal posts

example.name: More ArgMs
example.text: She fended off her assailant with a swift boot between his legs.

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: Her boot to his bare backside sent him sprawling face first in the dirt.

roleset.name: also; in addition to
roleset.note: BOOT-V NOTES: frame created by Jena (from boot.02-v)

example.name: to boot
example.text: You can look younger * to boot.

roleset.name: computer's boot up
roleset.note: BOOT-N NOTES: Roleset based on OntoNotes grouping boot-n sense 9, no equivalent verb entry, no mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from boot.02-n)

roles.note: No examples found of arg0. (from boot.02-n)

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: MBR is a section of the storage space on a hard disk drive that is used for the maintenance of data needed to initiate a boot of the computer.

roleset.name: boot up, start a computer
roleset.note: BOOT_UP-N NOTES: Same as boot.02 with particle. (from boot.03-n)

example.name: Arg 1 only
example.text: Upon boot-up of the computer a screen will ask which drive to boot from.

example.name: Arg 1 as possessor
example.text: My PC's boot up is so slow; I should've spent the money on a Mac.
